definitions.definition: The first five books of the Hebrew Scriptures, attributed to Moses and therefore also known as the Five Books of Moses.
definitions.example: Tradition holds that the Torah was handed down to Moses on Mount Sinai.

definitions.definition: The full body of written Jewish law, including the Tanakh, the Talmud, the Mishnah and the midrashic texts.
definitions.example: It says in the Torah that both gossip and murder cause irreparable damage.

definitions.definition: The whole of Jewish law, both written and unwritten.
A specially written scroll containing the five books of Moses, such as those used in religious services.
definitions.example: An anonymous donor has provided us with a lovely new Torah.

definitions.definition: A book containing the five books of Moses.
definitions.example: There was a lovely leather-bound Torah on the bookshelf.
